snippet: The Archdiocese of New York may close  28 elementary schools, the latest in a wave of shutdowns that has hit Catholic schools in the Northeast and Midwest.
abstract: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York is considering closing 28 elementary schools in latest wave that has swept away Catholic elementary schools in the Northeast and Midwest in recent decades; Cardinal Timothy M Dolan says that he hopes new revenue sources will make this latest round of closings the last of such broad scope; persistent operational deficits have forced most of the closings.
lead_paragraph: The Archdiocese of New York may close  28 elementary schools, the latest in a wave of shutdowns that has hit Catholic schools in the Northeast and Midwest.

headline.seo: Catholic Schools in New York Archdiocese Await More Closing Bells
headline.main: Catholic Schools Await More Closing Bells
headline.print_headline: Catholic Schools Await More Closing Bells
